    Machel Reid

    Researcher at the University of Tokyo working on natural language processing research

    • Email
    • Website
    • Twitter
    • Scholar

    Hi There! Name's Machel

    I’m a 16-year-old researcher at the University of Tokyo, working on NLP Research at Matsuo Lab advised by Yutaka Matsuo. I’m also currently a research intern at CMU, advised by Graham Neubig. I am currently working on ways to increase transferability of pretrained representations to low resource languages, as well as text style transfer , but I am also interested in/working on definitions, translation, and anything to do with deep generative models (like VAEs). I currently collaborate with NeuLab @ CMU, UWNLP, and FAIR.

    News

    • Our paper: LEWIS: Levenshtein Editing for Unsupervised Text Style Transfer was accepted to ACL-IJCNLP 2021 (Findings) - May 2021

    • Our paper: Variational Inference for Learning Representations of Natural Language Edits was accepted to AAAI 2021 - December 2020

    • Our paper VCDM: Leveraging Variational Bi-encoding and Deep Contextualized Word Representations for Improved Definition Modeling was accepted at EMNLP 2020. Its my 1st first-author conference submission, so I’m extremely happy about this! - September 2020

    • I’m extremely grateful to be accepted as a 4th Generation Masason Foundation Scholar! - July 2020

    • Our paper: Variational Inference for Learning Representations of Natural Language Edits was accepted to the non-archival track of the 5th Workshop of Representation Learning for NLP at ACL 2020 - May 2020
